title: Win a holiday to Austria's Ski Juwel
text:
Ski Competitions Win a holiday to Austria's Ski Juwel Enjoy seven nights in the Austrian ski resort of Alpbach, in the heart of the Tirol region, worth £2,000 The Ski Juwel area has 109km of varied pistes 12:46PM BST 24 Sep 2015 Comments 
Offering 109km of slopes, the Ski Juwel ski area has plenty of terrain to suit all abilities. 
The area was created three years ago when the resorts of Alpbach and Wildschönau in Austria were linked. 
Beginners can enjoy wide, gentle pistes, there are extensive slopes for intermediates, and freestylers are well catered for with three terrain parks. There are also plenty of other activities available, including tobogganing, snowshoeing and sleigh rides. 
The area’s small Tirolean villages are full of rustic mountain charm and offer a wide variety of accommodation to suit every budget. In Alpbachtal, the pretty resort of Alpbach offers some challenging runs and has long been a British favourite. It is lift linked to Auffach in Wildschönau where you will also find the small resorts of Niederau and Oberau, which are a short ride away from Auffach on the free ski bus. 
Wherever you decide to stay, Ski Juwel is a great place for families, with dedicated nursery slopes and children’s areas, friendly English-speaking instructors and family lift-pass discounts. 
Ski Juwel and the Tirol Tourist Board are offering Telegraph Ski and Snowboard readers the chance to win a week’s holiday for two, worth £2,000, to Alpbach, including seven nights’ half-board at the four-star Romantik Hotel Böglerhof , six-day Ski Juwel lift passes, return flights from London Gatwick and resort transfers. 
The closing date for entries is midnight on November 3 2015. Terms and conditions apply.
